newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore stockmarket drifts sideways at open.
newsitem.headline: Singapore stockmarket drifts sideways at open.

text.p: The Singapore stockmarket drifted sideways in exceptionally thin early trade on Wednesday as dealers digested a heavy overnight crop of corporate results.

Most dealers expected the market to rally later in reaction to Tuesday's sharp sell-off which was prompted by news of the U.S. attack on Iraq. They said most blue chip stocks looked cheap and the market may be close to its mid-year low.
"The heavily-weighted blue chips should recover from this position," said one broker.
By 0125 GMT, the Straits Times Industrials Index (STII) was 3.09 points higher at 2,108.35.
Dealers said good half-year results late on Tuesday from property firm Malayan Credit and as-expected interims from car retailer Cycle and Carriage should help push up these stocks later in the day.
Early market volume was exceptionally thin. Most of the volume for companies on the top actives board came from small-scale off-market crosses, dealers said.
